intro: Canthium mildbraedii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its spiny, branched stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soils, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
